topic.title: Perhaps there aren't many dumber than UK police?
topic.body:
UK police tell parents to check if their kids use Linux or Discord because it means they could be hackers

https://reclaimthenet.org/uk-police-kids-parents-linux-discord/

Pretty mind boggling.......

1580640062_141cDEZpTXUnEtreAL9ELWzcNqdNt.body: Why should I care. Sell me.

1580758021_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsK.body:
Thank you. Funniest story I've heard in a long time....and we need stories like this as an antidote to pompous buffoonery we endure every day at the hands of "public servants".

I would hope that at least one of these officers  appreciates the lultz here. 

Am always dismayed by the drug culture and always hope for miraculous cures. But I'm even more dismayed by this idea that ANY society feels it should have the right to persecute individuals destroying themselves. Sad, sad, state of affairs when we sink that low. Basic property rights. Who owns your body. YOU or the state?

The present system of persecuting drug losers is evil.

1580617751_1G5J3JZZ6SZtdsSAS3etngxaTXjcN.body:
We need a new word to describe "hiding in plain sight". Ways to use the clearnet to carry covert messages.

Delta chat is close to that. Using email for encrypted voice payloads. One could setup a bunch of raspberry pis en mass on IPV6 with closed or open email servers to build quite a network.

Similarly, covert communications over VOIP connections, or encrypted posts on public boards.

Many desperate pleas from Iranian citizens were unanswered last month because everyone was focused on "uber networks" instead of devilishly simple things which allow one to "get things done".

Even "flashlight networks" are mostly ignored, except for a few obscure articles about ethernet over visible light (LIFI).

https://wiki.p2pfoundation.net/Scuttlebutt
https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2017/05/meet-the-counterantidisintermediationists/527553/


Pretty ingenious sneakernet. Stay away from pubs - and it doesn't use networking at all.

1581540627_16aoHyKbwpvBmgCtNqX1tW9N5bvXG.body:
Why this happens? Your government does not fear you. That's a sorry state of affairs.

But when individual MPs start fearing "noise in the night" - this nonsense will stop.

Brits are the new surrender monkeys. Surrender monkeys exist all over the world now, but it's still amazing how quickly Brits gave up free speech.

> [robinofdeath](#comment_29_1367VTupfj886Uk39iT4RjiSmrakiDYTga): love how the guardian reports this like its about helping people and not inevitably going to be used against political opponents. this is an outright socialist newspaper reporting the actions of the conservative government as if its all fine and dandy. people in the uk are such authoritarians. fuck the state.

Nothing the Guardian publishes is remotely correct.

> [xcape2net](#comment_666_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): The Guardian is the paper that Edward Snowden chose to use  to release his information, so at least we know he trusts it.

It's so sad he was forced to trust this wimpy paper.

> [somuchfood](#comment_84_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4AeNaVvk): due to situations like this, sometimes im grateful i live in a backwards country...

Likely fewer nutjobs in your country, with a populace more tolerant and willing to mind it's own business.

> [moor](#comment_394_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH): i won't go too far here on how well a certain percentage of the population lived for how long but i will ask a more important question. [...]

Freedom generally seems to exist for only brief periods. Exciting periods when people try new things.

I worry about the business birth rate vs the death rate in this country. One does need regulation to prevent cheating and abuse....but it requires a wisdom well beyond anyone we've hired :(

> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_1843_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): freedom does not exist

Bullshit. If you're willing to go all the way - you are free until they kill you.

McVeigh was free.

1581413099_12V9AjYgcFFTD5rF89JUNqYcQTm2k.body:
Too many rules. Rules are always made for "other people".

But I'll admit that there are problems with no rules too :(

1581391651_1GDtf6kkYiCtruw42QmAeaHG1HsrW.body:
FBI is a dogshit agency with it's hands on every American's throat. Deserves to die....with no possibility of federal rehire.

It's time to take out the trash.

Those Chinese hackers will be taken care of their own stupid government unleashing plagues upon them....

1581116791_1Ev2p6pn33TkPNNrMbNFwSspPzivp.body:
Trump has lots of warts, but many still support him.

If you're one of those with full derangement,  quit bellyaching and act. ANYONE can be killed if the killer is willing to pay the price. They'll ultimately get you - but he'd still be dead.

Asimoz wrote 60 yrs ago about a ruler who despaired for his people. "Not one assassination attempt in 60 yrs." No one felt strongly enough to act. That ruler felt there was no way to save his society.

> [cannabissmoker](#comment_1_1FmC53ZDqp15korLaKkB5XENMJguuxrzLT): I fucking hate trump!

Have a lollipop

1581696052_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_1846_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): you miss the point: i made myselfi won't give you anything

Then you don't really count in any shape, way, or form. You're just another complainer. Stick a bottle in your mouth and shut up. There's work to be done.....

1581695503_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4Ae.body:
Just live the example and freely answer questions WHEN ASKED.

You obviously have no grasp of the anti celebrity backlash out there - which clearly you're courting. Backlash exists and it's growing rapidly. Getting to the point where if an "influencer" advised "brush your teeth" - some would refuse just to spite them.

1581605111_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: Why would you use this instead of onionshare or a family owned onion server with security cookies?

We will soon see children suing their parents for overexposing their likeness on Facebook :) It's coming .....

Stupid will not be considered a valid defense.

1581330554_19WWfebCWifDRTKiapRbErUjEpDDY.body:
I never liked opening the browser automatically, but often use firefox to post to Zeronet localhost. Has far fewer problems than the tor browser for this purpose.

Not really concerned about leaks into the clearnet since the browser always accesses the net through a VPN proxy.

1582197021_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3Gf.body:
John Belushi isn't dead. And it owns Zero hedge. Uses it to shove burrs up everyone's butt.

Getting people desensitized to fiction and fantasy is in everyone's interest. Then perhaps, they'll believe their own eyes.

Endless outrage is a drug. It keeps food on the table for many - but at what cost to "rest of us"?

> [zenanon](#comment_65_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEGimc9J): Doubt it. They recently got kicked off Twitter for spreading the "rumor" that Coronavirus was made in a lab. More mainstream media started reporting the same thing a couple of weeks later. Zerohedge is still banned from Twitter. :(

Getting banned from Twitter is becoming an honor :)

> [zenanon](#comment_65_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEGimc9J): Doubt it. They recently got kicked off Twitter for spreading the "rumor" that Coronavirus was made in a lab. More mainstream media started reporting the same thing a couple of weeks later. Zerohedge is still banned from Twitter. :(

I have that paper from India's CDC. It's real. They make no claims other than 5ea unusual gene sequences.

Instead of condemning this report, I'd like to see the results replicated in other countries....so we'd learn if it's true or not.


This is second hand, but flows though normal church contacts. An individual tasked with developing a vaccine for the Zika virus very matter of factly stated that the Chinese physician warning of the virus did NOT die from it. He was executed by Chinese authorities (WTF?). Now I don't know her sources, but she has routine contact with Chinese researchers and knows about that research facility in Wuhan. She did NOT make any claim that the virus had been engineered.....

Soooooo, sumptin's not right in China. My personal shorthand guess is that someone screwed up and China is trying to obscure it's culpability. All governments do this when they screw up.

> [zenanon](#comment_70_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEGimc9J): Are you referencing the report where there were HIV sequences in Coronavirus? I believe that. My "doubt it" was in reference to Zerohedge being controlled by CIA and etc. If ZH was controlled opposition why would they be getting kicked off Twitter? I like ZH's Coronavirus reporting. Am I incorrect to feel that way?

"Am I incorrect to feel that way?"

I have no idea. While it's clear that ZH has a bias which is sometimes difficult to detect or even filter out - they often uncover "inconvenient facts" other sources ignore. This looks like one to me.

Ask yourself, if that virus had originated in the US within the same city as a level 4 virus lab - would ANYONE there have escaped scrutiny? There would have been a pile on extraordinaire. 

So is China special? Do they get a free pass when a killer virus emerges? 

https://abcnews.go.com/Business/dow-jones-plummets-900-points-coronavirus-cases-surge/story?id=69174540

Worldwide death toll now exceeds 2600.

> [zenanon](#comment_70_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEGimc9J): Are you referencing the report where there were HIV sequences in Coronavirus? I believe that. My "doubt it" was in reference to Zerohedge being controlled by CIA and etc. If ZH was controlled opposition why would they be getting kicked off Twitter? I like ZH's Coronavirus reporting. Am I incorrect to feel that way?

I value ZH too. They are not completely reliable but remain a useful early warning tool.

Bannon recently indicated in a podcast that the Wuhan Virus center was built by the French in 2004. Who had debated a long time before consenting to build that facility for the CCP. The CCP had argued that such a facility was essential if they were to have any chance in battling another SARS outbreak. The French were concerned China would turn it into a bioweapons lab, but ultimately relented - accepting the CCP's word it would not be used for that purpose.

And then India's CDC comes out with this analysis of the corona virus. That analysis may be damning.

> [0435048ijg](#comment_7_1e6paNoDoqwCZGNa4o4uX43GrawvJuVB5): God, is there anyone who uses this place who isn't a total fucking retard?

(checking armpits) Sniff, sniff.

> [thetruth](#comment_104_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3GfgTQUQ): They have infiltrated everything, when I mean everything, all our lives, it's EVIL and part of the AGENDA.

God damn Jehovah's witnesses......

1582170690_1GDtf6kkYiCtruw42QmAeaHG1HsrW.body:
More likely - they just fucked up. This smells like a big one. One of their nasties "never to used" escaped.

Has occurred to me that since this virus hits Asians particularly hard, it might have been used by the CCP to enforce discipline among their own. If you are loyal - you get the vaccine. If not - you die.

Now if the Chinese people ever discover something like this as truth - what will their reaction be? Frightening, because all those commissars will seek to escape to the west - and we want no part of them.

Probably is not easy to be Chinese :(

1582169978_1e6paNoDoqwCZGNa4o4uX43GrawvJ.body:
> [sfs9](#comment_41_1Ev2p6pn33TkPNNrMbNFwSspPzivpKaTKD): Is there any particular reason, why any sane person would like to rape anybody, specially an old man?

If you knew his record in NYC, you might want to find a bunch of deviants to administer such a punishment. So far at least, he's escaped all punishment.

1582442446_1JmxhPt4FDP7rTmmaxoKdwTSDhwg5.body:
You can delete those files you don't wish to seed, but a better solution is to just place Zeronet on a separate LUKS encrypted drive and run it from there.

I would argue that "putting up a fight" against censorship requires citizens to take some risks. No one ever said your freedoms could not be taken if you aren't willing to fight. The fact that you're even running Zeronet and are even concerned about breaking rules should be disconcerting here. Perhaps you just need to do what you're told?

We're headed for a time where the only real defense from wrongthink is a dead man's switch. Not your gig? Gethefuckouttahere.

> [zanon](#comment_2_19NNH1RF6TRJUjp1qpT7Ri6opWw5yHpw7m): It's pretty obvious he's talking about CP. You act like he just spat on the floor of your house just because he doesn't want literal child pornography on his fucking hard drive lmao [...]

Nuther free speech fair weather friend.....

No fucks given unless you setup a damn seeder and leave it alone. Blocklists are fine....but endless hand wringing just insures you'll only talk - not actually DO anything. Be a zero.

You're probably also another Tor parasite who refuses to endure the bother of setting up a relay....

1582356450_12tcdM86TcZQeHEsSea3kTdTiExBK.body:
That does look odd. *IF* it has anything to do with foreigners illegally in this country - hope they impale their heads at the city gate. We pay a lot in taxes to pay for "protector bozos". Just when the hell are they supposed to deliver?

Virginia is a particular shithole right now due to politics rising above competence.

1582033580_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3Gf.body:
Perhaps I'm naive, but I suspect Assange is exactly what he claims. A journalist dedicated in publishing the truth.

Now I'm aware of his other disgusting personal habits, but that doesn't mean he failed to do good work in speaking truth to power.

Show me another journalist doing that.

> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_427_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): The rapes were false. Even the women admitted they consented.

I don't know anything about that case, but it always smelled. Personally believe if female failed to shoot the balls off of her "attacker" - she gave consent. Haven't heard eports of Assange suffering such injuries......

1582006484_182MiECzFBoPjv3gU6tq2k9BXSboK.body:
Freenet seems to be dying, but Zeronet still has a pulse.

I like the way Kocis(sp) built his system on existing protocols like Tor hidden services - instead of developing his own. Security is hard.

> [z0net](#comment_8_1KpsEG8BKkSJPFv8VVbngfC7xToMrYDJfS): This is true. I still support Freenet by having a huge datastore and having it sharing all the time. I think it is worthy of knowing about and exploring from a historical and technical standpoint. I will always love Freenet and it's use of plugins like Sone, Frost, MuWire, FMS. [...]

I admire your efforts. The world needs more like you.

> [nazmi](#comment_10_182MiECzFBoPjv3gU6tq2k9BXSboKzDVKF): But thanks for the insights, even though they're a bit grim xd about freenet

Honestly, I really don't know anything about Freenet. More accurately was talking out of my ass. Don't listen to fools like that :)

I did elect to go around Freenet after reaching some stories suggesting the feds had cracked it. That seems a constant problem with the windows platform. Now I do believe the feds have cracked Tor also ...but it still gives them fits...and that's good enough for my purposes :)

> [nazmi](#comment_9_182MiECzFBoPjv3gU6tq2k9BXSboKzDVKF): Pardon me for the perharps stupid question, who'd Kocis? A Zeronet dev?

I probably misspelled his name. It's all here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZeroNet

He gave a Ted talk a few years back.

All of us are indebted to giants......Kocsis mattered.

1582577947_1DnpB2yFpVwyhA29h2rRsifGVEC1s.body:
It's a consequence of "loss of trustworthiness" in governments. No one sees them as a source of fact.
And the media? Even worse.

https://www.jpost.com/HEALTH-SCIENCE/Israeli-scientists-In-three-weeks-we-will-have-coronavirus-vaccine-619101

For the past four years, a team of MIGAL scientists has been developing a vaccine against infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), which causes a bronchial disease affecting poultry. The effectiveness of the vaccine has been proven in preclinical trials carried out at the Veterinary Institute.

“Let’s call it pure luck,” he said. “We decided to choose coronavirus as a model for our system just as a proof of concept for our technology.”

1582876093_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEG.body:
Two points:

08chan has a posting limit. If you post more than 5GB(?) - your post won't sign. So it never will be seeded. At that point, you need to obtain another ZeroID.

Second, ZeroNet appears to be "tracker bound", and the more trackers you can connect to - the better your performance will be. This problem is particularly acute for Tor users.

One current fix (they are working on others) - simpley have your zeronet.conf file import a maintained/updated tracker list. It will look something like this:

[global]
trackers_file = 
 data/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/cache/1/_h_.html
trackers = 
 zero://boot3rdez4rzn36x.onion:15441
 zero://zero.booth.moe#f36ca555bee6ba216b14d10f38c16f7769ff064e0e37d887603548cc2e64191d:443
 udp://tracker.coppersurfer.tk:6969
 udp://amigacity.xyz:6969
 udp://104.238.198.186:8000
 http://tracker01.loveapp.com:6789/announce
 http://open.acgnxtracker.com:80/announce
 http://open.trackerlist.xyz:80/announce
 zero://2602:ffc5::c5b2:5360:26312
tor = always
open_browser = False
fileserver_port = 50014
tor_controller = 127.0.0.1:9151
tor_proxy = 127.0.0.1:9150

1582788975_19NNH1RF6TRJUjp1qpT7Ri6opWw5y.body:
> [32767](#comment_8_1CQXqzcFLdzbuFCAeBSprGqn8nvZpHyySR): The people that have been de-platformed by conventional social media need a place to vent their worldview. That's a primary reason the seek privacy-conscious and difficult to silence means such as *chans and onion forums.ZN should implement a blacklist, or a shadowban system to help them keep their ignorant worldview to themselves.

*You* are precisely the type of arrogant fool I'd like to slap the shit out of. Or split your skull. 

In most parts of ZeroNet - you DO have a personal blacklist. That's all you need. If it's not enough, you just need killin.

There must be a gene in humankind. A gene that makes us mind everyone else's business. That gene should be ruthlessly culled.

Ever notice how rules are ALWAYS made for "other people"?

> [xcape2net](#comment_678_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): People don't understand freedom.  They think it's possible for them as individuals to have it while everyone else is prevented from having it.

Some of the attitudes I've witnessed recently just make my jaw drop. Would never have believed this possible. Seems there's almost a "little Stalin" in everyone.

There's no option but to cull such people. They can't be salvaged. It's either "them" or yourself.

Virtue signalers and tattletales beware. The next individual you bother may end you. Free speech/scolding is fine...but when you use the state to enforce your worldview - you are fair game. And a silent majority won't miss you. They'll be happy they won't hafta step in your dog poop anymore. 

ZeroNet is a kiss my ass kinda place. Don't like it? Then leave pussy. Nobody wants you here.

1582649582_13EafRdDw5sZF42dTn68uDdcssTWK.body:
If you don't want it, then don't use it. But please shut up about it.

Rules are always made for "other people", and anything beyond banning murder is just someone on a megalomaniac trip.

When you start drawing lines for other people - don't be surprised when they strike back.

1582898213_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
I would love to able to access a communications network truly free of any government's control.

Governments are just parasitic animals with their constant mission creep.

> [xcape2net](#comment_676_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Me too.  Unfortunately, I think the only way to do that may be to create one myself.

It's harder than you think - after you get past the very local WANs.

Elon Musk might pull a sneaky for us with his lightweight satellites (no room for spy shit) - but even that probably would not last.
